verses.text: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

similars.text: After I had retired to the place where I had previously designed to go, having looked around me, and finding myself alone, I kneeled down and began to offer up the desires of my heart to God. I had scarcely done so, when immediately I was seized upon by some power which entirely overcame me, and had such an astonishing influence over me as to bind my tongue so that I could not speak. Thick darkness gathered around me, and it seemed to me for a time as if I were doomed to sudden destruction.
Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
And I was with you in weakness, and in fear, and in much trembling.

verses.text: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

And, behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not able to speak, until the day that these things shall be performed, because thou believest not my words, which shall be fulfilled in their season.

verses.text: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

similars.text: Verily I say unto you, even now, if he will hearken unto my voice, it shall be well with him. Even so. Amen.
Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.
And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.
Therefore if I know not the meaning of the voice, I shall be unto him that speaketh a barbarian, and he that speaketh shall be a barbarian unto me.
And the Lord said unto him: Believest thou the words which I shall speak?
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.

And the Lord said unto Enoch: Go forth and do as I have commanded thee, and no man shall pierce thee. Open thy mouth, and it shall be filled, and I will give thee utterance, for all flesh is in my hands, and I will do as seemeth me good.
If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or whether I speak of myself.
And if any man lift his voice against you he shall be confounded in mine own due time.
That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.

verses.text: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

similars.text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.

And now, behold, the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand.
And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.
And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
But they receive it not; for they perceive not the light, and they turn their hearts from me because of the precepts of men.
And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.
And behold, O Lord, in them there is no light; whither shall we steer? And also we shall perish, for in them we cannot breathe, save it is the air which is in them; therefore we shall perish.
And when the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their purpose, loosing thence, they sailed close by Crete.
And it came to pass that when Jesus had touched them all, there came a cloud and overshadowed the multitude that they could not see Jesus.
And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

verses.text: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

similars.text: That thy church may come forth out of the wilderness of darkness, and shine forth fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners;
And in the morning, It will be foul weather to day: for the sky is red and lowring. O ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky; but can ye not discern the signs of the times?
Hearken ye, for, behold, the great day of the Lord is nigh at hand.
Howl ye, for the day of the Lord is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.
Behold, the day of the Lord cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate; and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.
Looking for and hasting unto the coming of the day of God, wherein the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat?
And let thy house be filled, as with a rushing mighty wind, with thy glory.

And it came to pass that the Lord God caused that there should be a furious wind blow upon the face of the waters, towards the promised land; and thus they were tossed upon the waves of the sea before the wind.
Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.
That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.

verses.text: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

similars.text: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.

But this cannot be; we must come forth and stand before him in his glory, and in his power, and in his might, majesty, and dominion, and acknowledge to our everlasting shame that all his judgments are just; that he is just in all his works, and that he is merciful unto the children of men, and that he has all power to save every man that believeth on his name and bringeth forth fruit meet for repentance.
O how great the holiness of our God! For he knoweth all things, and there is not anything save he knows it.
How can we expect that God will stay his hand in judgment against us?
Let no man think he is ruler; but let God rule him that judgeth, according to the counsel of his own will, or, in other words, him that counseleth or sitteth upon the judgment seat.

And they answered the king, and said: Whether he be the Great Spirit or a man, we know not; but this much we do know, that he cannot be slain by the enemies of the king; neither can they scatter the king's flocks when he is with us, because of his expertness and great strength; therefore, we know that he is a friend to the king. And now, O king, we do not believe that a man has such great power, for we know he cannot be slain.
Great is his wisdom, marvelous are his ways, and the extent of his doings none can find out.
And he did do justice unto the people, but not unto himself because of his many whoredoms; wherefore he was cut off from the presence of the Lord.
The lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him, and in an hour that he is not aware of,
The lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him, and in an hour that he is not aware of,

verses.text: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.

similars.text: For, behold, you should not have feared man more than God. Although men set at naught the counsels of God, and despise his words--
And the mean man boweth not down, and the great man humbleth himself not, therefore, forgive him not.
Wherefore, let every man beware lest he do that which is not in truth and righteousness before me.
And he said unto them, Take heed, and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consisteth not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.
For I feared thee, because thou art an austere man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and reapest that thou didst not sow.
But behold he doth not command us that we shall subject ourselves to our enemies, but that we should put our trust in him, and he will deliver us.
The weak things of the world shall come forth and break down the mighty and strong ones, that man should not counsel his fellow man, neither trust in the arm of flesh--
Forasmuch as this people draw near unto me with their mouth, and with their lips do honor me, but have removed their hearts far from me, and their fear towards me is taught by the precepts of men--
Behold, I say unto you, David, that you have feared man and have not relied on me for strength as you ought.
